metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4136 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ext/common/ServerInstanceDir.h in Phusion Passenger gem before 4.0.6 for Ruby allows local users to gain privileges or possibly change the ownership of arbitrary directories via a symlink attack on a directory with a predictable name in /tmp/.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4136` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-passenger - 4.0.37-2
ruby-passenger - 4.0.37-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-passenger package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.37-2').
